comments.body: It's a little weird... I guess I don't consider the `?` to be part of the type annotation, so I'm surprised that a person would have to turn off `NoSpaceBeforeQuestionMark` to avoid this behavior?

@DanielRosenwasser Not sure that I correctly understood your concern. `NoSpaceBeforeQuestionMark` doesn't use any option to enable/disable it, this rule applies by default

The issue that `?` token can be used to define optional parameter/property,
```ts
function foo(x ?: number) {}
```
So `NoSpaceBeforeQuestionMark` conflicts with the `SpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation`/`NoSpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation`, therefore need to exclude checking type annotations context in `NoSpaceBeforeQuestionMark`. 

If the `insertSpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation` is not enabled then `NoSpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation` will be applied because this rule uses `isOptionDisabledOrUndefined`, which means that the user can set` false` or delete this rule, and in both cases, the spaces will be removed.

If a user enables the option `insertSpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation`, formatted will add space before `" :"` and `" ?:"` as _ColonToken_ and _ColonToken_ + _QuestionToken_ are valid tokens in type annotations.

Or #25155 is not a bug and should be closed, and if a user enables option `insertSpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation`, formatted has to add space only before `:` and ignore `?:`.

What do you think?
